snippet: In staging the opera “Monkey: Journey to the West,” the director Chen Shi-Zheng urged the members of his Chinese cast to shed aspects of their past training.
abstract: Chen Shi-Zheng, stage and film director who has continually met challenge of bridging Chinese and Western approaches to story, has once again broken with tradition in his staging of opera Monkey: Journey to the West, which opens Lincoln Center Festival; Chen has cast Chinese actors comfortable with shedding aspects of their past training to embrace characters' motivations and mindset.
lead_paragraph: In staging the opera “Monkey: Journey to the West,” the director Chen Shi-Zheng urged the members of his Chinese cast to shed aspects of their past training.
